main event: An unidentified flight was observed near Kotzebue, Alaska, displaying a brilliant flash of light and a trailing vapor.
interesting points: The light was observed moving at an estimated speed of 650-750 mph at an altitude of 20,000 feet., The flash lasted for 10 seconds, while the vapor trail was visible for 15 minutes., The light was bright enough to read a newspaper at night., The sighting occurred from two miles south of Kotzebue while traveling by dog sled., No unusual weather conditions were reported at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: a brilliant white flash of light
witness description: One witness was a 29-year-old pastor, and the other was a 46-year-old reindeer herder.
